org.anarres.udev

Class Udev

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.anarres.udev.Udev
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    @NotThreadSafe
public class Udev
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    A Udev handle - start here. This object MUST be closed after use or a leak in the native heap will result. See http://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/libudev/

      You want this constructor.

      Returns the underlying native udev handle.

      Returns the underlying native library dev handle.

    • Method Detail

      • getLibrary

        @Nonnull
public UdevLibrary getLibrary()
        Returns the underlying native library dev handle. You probably don't want this.

      • getHandle

        @Nonnull
public UdevLibrary.udev getHandle()
        Returns the underlying native udev handle. You probably don't want this.

      • newEnumeration

        @Nonnull
public UdevEnumeration newEnumeration()
        Enumerates udev devices. The returned object is a builder pattern and is reusable.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this Udev object and releases all associated native resources. Once this object is closed, all associated UdevEnumeration objects become invalid, but UdevDevice objects may still be used.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
